definition: old fellow/old man/father/husband

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
backscratcher (made from bamboo etc)/(may also refer to other products that are of benefit to old people, such as padded cloth shoes, mobility tricycle etc)

sentences.english: A weak small spare old man.
Before long, along came this little old man.
sentences.chinese: 过了不久，沿路来了一个小老头。

sentences.english: The old man dared him to steal the bike.
sentences.chinese: 那老头调唆他去偷那辆自行车。

sentences.english: That ( old ) gaffer going into the pub is 90 years old.
sentences.chinese: 走进酒店的那个老头子已经90岁了。

sentences.english: It falls to the young girl's lot to marry this old man.
sentences.chinese: 嫁给这个老头是这个女孩命里注定的。

sentences.english: Except for the nightmarish old-man turtle, of course. [via PitchForkMedia]
sentences.chinese: 当然除了那只老头海龟。

sentences.english: The old man looked meditatively at the darts board.
sentences.chinese: 老头儿沉思不语，看着那投镖板。
你这个满脸鼻涕的老头子。

sentences.english: And you , fucking tell him now . what geezer.
sentences.chinese: 就一个老头子而言，你的身板儿还挺不错的。

sentences.english: "Light your lanthorn, old man, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “老头儿，把你的灯笼点亮，”他说。

sentences.english: At 19, he looked like a senior citizen compared with the ingénu that was Theo Walcott.
sentences.chinese: 19岁的他，比起年轻的沃尔科特来，就像个老头。

sentences.english: Sikes turned angrily towards the old man. The re was a silence.
sentences.chinese: 赛克斯生气地转向老头，谁也不吭声了。

sentences.english: Back then, I thought he was a crank.
sentences.chinese: 当时我认为他是个怪老头。

sentences.english: The old man kissed his knees and called him the good God.
sentences.chinese: 那个老头子吻着他的膝头，称他为慈悲的上帝。

sentences.english: With a malicious crackle the old man held up a small white swaddling garment.
sentences.chinese: 老头啪一声狠狠扯下毯子上的一个白色的小装饰。

sentences.english: 1A woman walks up to a little old man rocking in a chair on his porch.
sentences.chinese: 1一位女士走向坐在门廊的椅子上摇动的小老头。

definition: see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
old woman (at times contemptuous)
(coll.) boy/(derog.) joker/guy/(despicable) fellow
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]
(coll.) old fellow/old codger
variant of 家伙[jia1 huo5]
household dish, implement or furniture/domestic animal/(coll.) guy/chap/weapon
eldest of father's younger brothers/uncle (term used to address a man about the age of one's father)
my (you etc) old father/polite appellation for an elderly male
polite term for old woman or man
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
arrogant idler/self-centered show-off
great-grandmother
fat person/fatty
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
lame person (colloquial)
(coll.) father's father/paternal grandfather/CL:個|个[ge4]
old lady (term of modesty)
